hateful_meaning: A person of mixed Hispanic and Chinese parentage.
A town or part of town containing majority black population
Derogatory portmanteau of 'piss' and 'islam'
A person of Chinese descent. Considered extremely derogatory, exemplified by a US school that had to stop using the term as a sports mascot in 1980.
A person of mixed Hispanic and Chinese parentage.
A black person.
A promiscuous person, usually applied to women
An unpaid servant, generally recognized as property rather than as a human being. May specifically refer to a person of African origin.
A black person.
A black person.
A black person
A black person. Jiggaboo or jigabo is from a Bantu verb tshikabo, meaning meek or servile.
A black person. Jiggaboo or jigabo is from a Bantu verb tshikabo, meaning meek or servile.
Denotes a person that is half African.
A person who's overt about his/her Hispanic descent, particularly a Dominican

An Asian, especially an enemy soldier of Asian descent. Its use as an ethnic slur has been traced to US Marines serving in the Philippines in the early 20th century. The earliest recorded example is dated 1920. It gained widespread notice as a result of the Korean and Vietnam wars.
Person of Middle Eastern descent.
A person of common or low class Irish ancestry.
A person of Arab descent.
A black person.
A person of Chinese descent. Considered extremely derogatory, exemplified by a US school that had to stop using the term as a sports mascot in 1980.

A person of Hispanic descent. First recorded use in 1915. Theories include from 'no spik English' (and spiggoty from the Chicano no speak-o t'e English), but common belief is that it is an abbreviation of 'Hispanic'.
A transgender person
Alternative spelling for adjective for the nature of 'spic'
Combination of 'she' and 'baboon' to indicate a black woman
Alternative form of 'negro'
An Ashkenazi Jew. From kikel, Yiddish for 'circle'. Illiterate immigrant Jews signed legal documents with an 'O' (similar to an 'X').

A female Native American. Derived from lower East Coast Algonquian (Massachuset: ussqua), which originally meant 'young woman', but which took on strong negative connotations in the late 20th century.
A black person.
A person of Hawaiian descent.
A black person.
A black person.

[1] Used in 19th-century United States to refer to the Irish. [2] Sometimes used today in reference to white people in a manner similar to white trash or redneck. [3] Also refers to white youth that imitate urban black youth by means of clothing style, mannerisms, and slang speech. The 'w' at the start of wigger refers to the white person and the 'igger' refers to nigger, which is a racial slur for black people. [4] Also used by radical Quebecois in self-reference, as in the seminal 1968 book White Niggers of America.
A Native American person.
A person of Arab descent.
A black person.
A black person.
A black person.
A black person.
Derogatory term for a person from the Middle East, Arab, South Asian world
A black child.
A black person.
A person of mixed Hispanic and black parentage.
A black person. Jiggaboo or jigabo is from a Bantu verb tshikabo, meaning meek or servile.

[1] Used in 19th-century United States to refer to the Irish. [2] Sometimes used today in reference to white people in a manner similar to white trash or redneck. [3] Also refers to white youth that imitate urban black youth by means of clothing style, mannerisms, and slang speech. The 'w' at the start of wigger refers to the white person and the 'igger' refers to nigger, which is a racial slur for black people. [4] Also used by radical Quebecois in self-reference, as in the seminal 1968 book White Niggers of America.

[1] Used in 19th-century United States to refer to the Irish. [2] Sometimes used today in reference to white people in a manner similar to white trash or redneck. [3] Also refers to white youth that imitate urban black youth by means of clothing style, mannerisms, and slang speech. The 'w' at the start of wigger refers to the white person and the 'igger' refers to nigger, which is a racial slur for black people. [4] Also used by radical Quebecois in self-reference, as in the seminal 1968 book White Niggers of America.
An Arab, Indian Sikh or other individual of Middle Eastern or South Asian descent wearing traditional headdress such as turbans or keffiyehs. Sometimes used generically for all Islamic nations.
A black person.
A black person.

A black person.
An Arab, Indian Sikh or other individual of Middle Eastern or South Asian descent wearing traditional headdress such as turbans or keffiyehs. Sometimes used generically for all Islamic nations.

In Canada, an unsophisticated person, Back when Hockey was played on frozen ponds and lakes the losers of the hockey game would have to hose the lakes to become clean, smooth ice.  Calling someone a “hoser” is really just calling them a loser.  From the practice of stealing gas with a hose and siphon.
A person of Latino descent, particularly a Mexican migrant laborer.

An Asian, especially an enemy soldier of Asian descent. Its use as an ethnic slur has been traced to US Marines serving in the Philippines in the early 20th century. The earliest recorded example is dated 1920. It gained widespread notice as a result of the Korean and Vietnam wars.
A person with dark skin, most commonly an Afro-Caribbean
[1] An Asian. [2] A Vietnamese person. [3] A North Vietnamese soldier or guerrilla in the Vietnam War.
An Ashkenazi Jew (though typically generalized to all Jews). From kikel, Yiddish for 'circle'. Illiterate immigrant Jews signed legal documents with an 'O' (similar to an 'X').
An increase in African-American / African influence
One expressing homosexually tendencies
Alternative use of the term 'nigger'
Female diminuitive of 'nigger'
A homosexual of African descent
To increase African American / African influence
Describing the texture of African American hair
To have something completed poorly, shoddy construction
The combination of 'jew' and 'retard'
One who has sexual relations with Jews
A homosexual male
A derogatory contraction of the words "didn't do nothing," popularized as a slur against black people as a mockery of regional pronunciation
Holocaust hoax (Holocaust denial)
A person of Irish descent, derived from a nickname for Padraig.
A person of Latino descent, particularly a Mexican migrant laborer.
Combination of American and 'coon'
A black Canadian.
In Northern Ireland, a spide is a young working class male. A female is known as a millie.
A rural person or resident of a small town.
As with Uncle Tom, a reference to a black person who is subservient to whites.
One who is of mixed race.
A black child.
A black child.
A black Jew, from the combination of Hebrew and 'bro'.
A homosexual.
A town or part of town containing majority black population
Abbreviation of the term 'retarded'
Japan
A disabled person
Acts of aggression commited by a black person
A black person. Jiggaboo or jigabo is from a Bantu verb tshikabo, meaning meek or servile.
A Jewish person (first used in the 1930s).
A black person. Jiggaboo or jigabo is from a Bantu verb tshikabo, meaning meek or servile.
Pejorative term which is shortened from either transgendered, transsexual or transvestite. May be used to refer to these individuals, or others, in a derogatory or offensive manner.

An Asian, especially an enemy soldier of Asian descent. Its use as an ethnic slur has been traced to US Marines serving in the Philippines in the early 20th century. The earliest recorded example is dated 1920. It gained widespread notice as a result of the Korean and Vietnam wars.

[1] A Romani people. [2] Egyptians. These are variations of 'Gypsy', the most common word in English for people of Romani origin. 'Gypsy' is not in itself an ethnic slur but its usage is sometimes controversial.
Black children.
A person of East Indian origin.
Denotes a person that is half African.
A black person. Jiggaboo or jigabo is from a Bantu verb tshikabo, meaning meek or servile.

A black person. The term may cause offense. though Randall Kennedy's Nigger: The Strange Career of a Troublesome Word notes that some judges have considered 'darky' a 'term of endearment.' In South Africa, it can be considered offensive (depending on the context), but is commonly used among black people to refer to other black people in a non-derogatory way.
A Polynesian.
A black person. Jiggaboo or jigabo is from a Bantu verb tshikabo, meaning meek or servile.

An Asian person. Used by American military personnel during the Korean War and Vietnam War. Also seen in the films Platoon, Apocalypse Now, Full Metal Jacket and Gran Torino. The phrase 'zips in the wire' from Platoon has also been used outside of this context.
Derogatory term for a Caucasian South African, possibly derived from the Dutch term 'plaasjapie' meaning a farm-boy
An infant of hispanic descent
An infant of hispanic descent
A Native American person

[1] Comparing someone (usually Male) to female genitalia. A variant of "pussy", but generally regarded as far more offensive. [2] A despicable man (Australian English). Has a wide variety of usages and meaning across the English world. For instance, in Commonwealth Countries such as Britain, Australia or New Zealand it can be, and often is, used to refer positively to someone, while in Canada it is widely seen to be highly offensive.
A hairy person of Jewish ancestry, from the Star Wars character, Chewbacca.
A Native American.
A disreputable and/or working class person, from 'scallywag'
[1] A transexual person. [2] A transgendered person. [3] An allegedly masculine woman.
A Native American.
Used as a derogatory term directed towards South Asians (and sometimes Middle Eastern people).
Having the tendendies of a disabled person
A derogatory contraction of the words "didn't do," popularized as a slur against black people as a mockery of regional pronunciation
A promiscuous person, usually applied to women
[1] A shiftless or unemployed person. [2] A pimp.
Person of Middle Eastern descent.
An Irish Traveller.

[1] Comparing someone (usually Male) to female genitalia. A variant of "pussy", but generally regarded as far more offensive. [2] A despicable man (Australian English). Has a wide variety of usages and meaning across the English world. For instance, in Commonwealth Countries such as Britain, Australia or New Zealand it can be, and often is, used to refer positively to someone, while in Canada it is widely seen to be highly offensive.
A name to call the Luos ethnic group in Kenya
An intentional misspelling of 'gay' meant to avoid censorship and mock homosexual behaviour
Derogatory portmanteau of Muslim and 'rat'
Perjorative diminuitive of Muslim
In the UK, a criminal dealing in counterfeit and/or stolen goods

A British (usually English) immigrant. Some claim it derives from 'Prisoner of Mother England' or 'Prisoner of Her Majesty', but it probably derives from pomegranate, rhyming slang for 'immigrant'. It is often used irreverently and is usually considered offensive. Many such migrants to Australia, such as Prime Minister Julia Gillard, call themselves 'ten pound poms', because they paid ten pounds for their passage to Australia between 1945 and 1972 under an assisted migration scheme. Often combined with an adjective, particularly whingeing pom, a reference to migrants who complained about their adopted country. Often used in a sporting (especially cricket and rugby) context, with liberal use of 'pom' and 'Aussie' being used by the media; the term is often seen as unoffensive in this context, and instead as light-hearted banter by those who use it, but still possibly as offensive by those whom it is directed at.
An Asian woman, particularly of Chinese descent.
A disabled person, from 'mongoloid'.
Combination of 'jig' and 'negro'
Pakistan

[1] Comparing someone (usually Male) to female genitalia. A variant of "pussy", but generally regarded as far more offensive. [2] A despicable man (Australian English). Has a wide variety of usages and meaning across the English world. For instance, in Commonwealth Countries such as Britain, Australia or New Zealand it can be, and often is, used to refer positively to someone, while in Canada it is widely seen to be highly offensive.
A person of Asian descent.
A poor or disenfranchised person of Irish descent.
A Jew, an allusion to Jewish deicide. On occasion it can also be used as an anti-Italian slur on the basis the Romans, as ancestors of the present-day Italians, executed Jesus.
A European.
A term used for an African American, or other person of African descent.
A person of Asian origin (Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Vietnamese etc.) Derived from the term for those who have epicanthic folds.
A Jewish person, derived from the personal name Hyman (from the Hebrew name Chayyim). Jesse Jackson provoked controversy by referring to New York City as 'Hymietown' in 1984.
Contraction of Zionist and Nazi, making a false comparison between Jews who support Israel's right to exist and Nazis.
An Australian Aboriginal woman.

[1] Australian aboriginal. Boong, pronounced with (like the vowel in bull), is related to the Australian English slang word bung, meaning dead; infected; or dysfunctional. From bung, to go bung 'Originally to die, then to break down, go bankrupt, cease to function [Ab. bong dead]'. Highly offensive. [2] In New Zealand, a Pacific Islander.
Zionist Occupation Government, an organization hypothesized by white supremacists to rule the world.
A Caucasian woman who dates a black man.
A black person referring to perceived common behavior of groups hanging out on front porches or steps of urban apartment complexes in US cities.
A homosexual.
[English][Italian] A black person.
A white person who is acting like a Japanese person
In the USA a person of Latino descent, from 'latrine'. Extremely offensive.
A person of Asian descent, particularly Vietnamese or Chinese.
A Jewish person (first used in the 1930s).
A Jewish person (first used in the 1930s).
Combination of African and 'coon'.
A Jewish person, derived from the word 'Hebrew'.
[1] A Japanese soldier or national, or anyone of Japanese descent. [2] Acronym for 'Jewish-American Princess.'
A Jewish person, derived from the word 'Hebrew'.
Broad derogatory term for someone of Asian appearance/descent.
A prostitute or promiscuous individual
A North American Indian (from the Algonquian word for 'friend').
Derogatory term referring to a stereotypical African-American woman
A term for African Americans
A non-Irish person who claims to be Irish.
A Roman Catholic person, usually Irish Catholic.
In Northern Ireland, a spide is a young working class male. A female is known as a millie.
In the UK, [1] an uneducated or lower class person, or [2] a policeman.
A black person.
A German, most specifically during World War II. From Sauerkraut.

[1] A Romani people. [2] Egyptians. These are variations of 'Gypsy', the most common word in English for people of Romani origin. 'Gypsy' is not in itself an ethnic slur but its usage is sometimes controversial.
A person of predominantly Caucasian ancestry with real or suspected African or Asian distant ancestry.

[1] A Romani people. [2] Egyptians. These are variations of 'Gypsy', the most common word in English for people of Romani origin. 'Gypsy' is not in itself an ethnic slur but its usage is sometimes controversial.

[1] A Romani people. [2] Egyptians. These are variations of 'Gypsy', the most common word in English for people of Romani origin. 'Gypsy' is not in itself an ethnic slur but its usage is sometimes controversial.

[1] A European American, with little or no social or blood links to any tribe, who claims to be an American Indian (Native American). [2] An Asian American who has become completely integrated into White American, or mainstream American culture.
A Caucasian of low class or limited income.
Among whites in South Africa, Zimbabwe, and Zambia, denotes a black person. Derives from muntu, the singular Bantu word for 'person'. In the UK, the word means 'ugly person', especially 'ugly woman'.
A lesbian.
A person of mixed white and black ancestry
An African-American
A person of Lebanese descent.
In Ireland, a disreputable or delinquent person
In Northern Ireland, a spide is a young working class male. A female is known as a millie.
A dishonest person, particularly of Jewish decent.

[1] In North America, unskilled Asian labor, usually Chinese (originally used in 19th-century for Chinese railroad labor). Possibly from Hindi kuli, day laborer. [2] Racial epithet for Indo-Caribbean people, especially in Guyana, Trinidad and Tobago and South African Indians.
A black person, used by Italians in US. It is a corruption of melanzane, the Italian word for eggplant.
A black person, used by Italians in US. It is a corruption of melanzane, the Italian word for eggplant.
A black person.
A black person. Possibly from Portuguese barracco, a building constructed to hold slaves for sale (1837). Popularized by the song 'Zip Coon', played at Minstrel shows in the 1830s.
A person of Lebanese descent.
Born of a Caucasian parent and a black parent.
A black person, used by Italians in US. It is a corruption of melanzane, the Italian word for eggplant.
An Asian person
Having the stereotypical characteristics of a white, anglo-saxon protestant
Short for Guatemalan.
A rural or unsophisticated person
A black person. Derived from 'negroid'.
Laborer-class whites in Barbados.
A Native American, from 'Indian'.

[1] Used in 19th-century United States to refer to the Irish. [2] Sometimes used today in reference to white people in a manner similar to white trash or redneck. [3] Also refers to white youth that imitate urban black youth by means of clothing style, mannerisms, and slang speech. The 'w' at the start of wigger refers to the white person and the 'igger' refers to nigger, which is a racial slur for black people. [4] Also used by radical Quebecois in self-reference, as in the seminal 1968 book White Niggers of America.

A person of Hispanic descent. First recorded use in 1915. Theories include from 'no spik English' (and spiggoty from the Chicano no speak-o t'e English), but common belief is that it is an abbreviation of 'Hispanic'.
A Caucasian woman who dates a black man.
A rural person, particularly of Scottish or Welsh descent, who is alleged to have sex with sheep due to the scarcity of people in the vicinity
Perpetuates false claim that Ashkenazi Jews are the result of a mass conversion in Khazaria to undermine Jewish national claims to Israel
A person of Indian or Middle Eastern descent, based on the perceived surfeit of immigrants driving cabs in the United States.

A person of Hispanic descent. First recorded use in 1915. Theories include from 'no spik English' (and spiggoty from the Chicano no speak-o t'e English), but common belief is that it is an abbreviation of 'Hispanic'.
White supremacist term for a black person.
A person of perceived Chinese or East Asian descent. An offensive term that has raised considerable controversy, for example when used by comedian Rosie O'Donnell.
[1] In Hawaii, an uneducated, lower class and/or ethnic Polynesian person. [2] In Ireland, a disreputable or lower class person.
A disreputable and/or working class person, from 'scallywag'
A Caucasian of low class or limited income.
A black person.
White supremacist term for a black person.
Term used by white supremacists to denote a person of mixed race.

[1] An inconsequential person (typically lower class). [2] A Gypsy. [3] In Scotland, a member of the native community previously itinerant (but mainly now settled) who were reputed for their production of domestic implements from basic materials and for repair of the same items, being also known in the past as 'travelling tinsmiths'. The slur is possibly derived from a reputation for rowdy and alcoholic recreation. Often wrongly confused with Gypsy/Romany people.

[1] An inconsequential person (typically lower class). [2] A Gypsy. [3] In Scotland, a member of the native community previously itinerant (but mainly now settled) who were reputed for their production of domestic implements from basic materials and for repair of the same items, being also known in the past as 'travelling tinsmiths'. The slur is possibly derived from a reputation for rowdy and alcoholic recreation. Often wrongly confused with Gypsy/Romany people.
Perjorative diminuitive of Muslim
A person accused of being an homosexual
An Arab, Indian Sikh or other individual of Middle Eastern or South Asian descent wearing traditional headdress such as turbans or keffiyehs. Sometimes used generically for all Islamic nations.
A Caucasian.
Acronym for White Irish Catholic.

Australian Aboriginal person. Originally, this was simply an informal term for Aborigine, and was in fact used by Aboriginal people themselves until it started to be considered offensive in the 1950s. In remoter areas, Aboriginal people still often refer to themselves (quite neutrally) as Blackfellas (and whites as Whitefellas). Although Abo is still considered quite offensive by many, the pejorative boong is now more commonly used when the intent is to deliberately offend, as that word's status as an insult is unequivocal.
A black person
A person who is 1/4 Black. Coined during the Civil War, referring to how White you had to be in order to serve in the army.
A person from South Asia or the Middle East, particularly a person from Pakistan.
A person who's overt about his/her Hispanic descent, particularly a Dominican
[1] A person of east African descent, from Cush (modern day Ethiopia or Sudan). [2] Any black African.
[1] A woman, from 'whore'. [2] A prostitute.
A black person.
Used in Hawaii to denote a black person.
A person of Irish descent.
Generic term for a loser or ineffectual person, likely from 'mook jonk', a wooden dummy used in kung-fu.
In Northern Ireland, a spide is a young working class male. A female is known as a millie.
A person of Latino descent, particularly a Mexican migrant laborer.
Referring to Muslims in Myanmar as an invasive species
A person of Latino descent, particularly a Mexican migrant laborer.
Pejorative term for one who suffers from Asperger syndrome.
An Australian
A 19th-century derogatory term for an 'untrustworthy Jew.'
Variant of 'sand nigger' in relation to inhabitants of desert regions or Arabs / Muslims in general
Derogatory portmanteau of Muslim and 'animal'
[1] An Arab. [2] A Muslim.
A dishonest person, particularly of Jewish decent.
People of Mexican descent or, more specifically, mestizos of Central American descent. The term originates from the use of frijoles pintos and other beans in Mexican food.
A Muslim.
A rural person.

Used in the south of England, relating to the supposed stupidity and lack of sophistication of those in the north of the country. In some cases this has been adopted in the north of England, with a pub in Leeds even taking the name 'The Northern Monkey'.

A person of Hispanic descent. First recorded use in 1915. Theories include from 'no spik English' (and spiggoty from the Chicano no speak-o t'e English), but common belief is that it is an abbreviation of 'Hispanic'.
[1] An Alaskan. [2] An Inuit.
A person in the Netherlands, which is 20% below sea level.
In Australia, Aboriginal pejorative term for white people.
A person of common or low class Irish ancestry.

A black person, especially a black child. More commonly used in states where alligators are found, particularly Florida. First used in the early 20th century, although some hypothesize the term originated in the late 19th century.
[1] An Alaskan. [2] An Inuit.
A disabled person, from 'retarded'.
A person who lives in a 'hood (neighborhood), particularly a poor woman who can be coerced into sex
A white person who is acting like a black person

A black person. The term may cause offense. though Randall Kennedy's Nigger: The Strange Career of a Troublesome Word notes that some judges have considered 'darky' a 'term of endearment.' In South Africa, it can be considered offensive (depending on the context), but is commonly used among black people to refer to other black people in a non-derogatory way.
An Asian woman, particularly of Chinese descent.
A person of Latino descent, particularly a Mexican migrant laborer.
A disabled person.
An overly tanned Caucasian
A person who has sold out their beliefs, referring to the Irish Potato famine when some Catholics converted to a Protestant faith in order to gain access to a free meal.
An uncultivated Australian.
In Ireland, a disreputable, working class or delinquent person
A person who is 1/8th Black. Originated by the Spanish in the 14th/15th century as they were very exact in their racial classifications to determine a person's worth in society.
An Italian person. Originated through the mispronunciation of 'Italian' as 'Eye-talian.'
A black person.

A person of Hispanic descent. First recorded use in 1915. Theories include from 'no spik English' (and spiggoty from the Chicano no speak-o t'e English), but common belief is that it is an abbreviation of 'Hispanic'.
Used by southern African-Americans and upper class whites to denote poor rural whites. It is still used mostly by African-Americans in reference to white people.
[1] A woman, from 'whore'. [2] A prostitute.
A woman of Italian descent
An Italian-American male. Derives from the Italian given name, Guido. Used mostly in the Northeastern United States as a stereotype for working-class urban Italian-Americans.

A British (usually English) immigrant. Some claim it derives from 'Prisoner of Mother England' or 'Prisoner of Her Majesty', but it probably derives from pomegranate, rhyming slang for 'immigrant'. It is often used irreverently and is usually considered offensive. Many such migrants to Australia, such as Prime Minister Julia Gillard, call themselves 'ten pound poms', because they paid ten pounds for their passage to Australia between 1945 and 1972 under an assisted migration scheme. Often combined with an adjective, particularly whingeing pom, a reference to migrants who complained about their adopted country. Often used in a sporting (especially cricket and rugby) context, with liberal use of 'pom' and 'Aussie' being used by the media; the term is often seen as unoffensive in this context, and instead as light-hearted banter by those who use it, but still possibly as offensive by those whom it is directed at.
A white or non-Asian person.
A term for Northerners used by Southerners within the United states or by non-Americans for Americans. From the Dutch Jan Kees ('John Cheese') meaning Englishman.
A term for Northerners used by Southerners within the United states or by non-Americans for Americans. From the Dutch Jan Kees ('John Cheese') meaning Englishman.

A swarthy or dark-skinned foreigner. Possibly derived from 'golliwogg' In Britain, it usually refers to dark skinned people from Asia or Africa, though some use the term to refer to anyone outside the borders of their own country. In Australia the term 'wog' is usually used to refer to Mediterranean Europeans (Spaniards, Italians, and Greeks) although it can be used for some Eastern Europeans, particularly those of the Balkans (Bosnians, Macedonians, Serbians, Croatians, or Albanians).
[1] A person of east African descent, from Cush (modern day Ethiopia or Sudan). [2] Any black African.
From "spastic", refers to a person who has seizures or other uncontrollable movements
A person of Arabic descent, from Aladdin and his magic carpet.

A black person. The term may cause offense. though Randall Kennedy's Nigger: The Strange Career of a Troublesome Word notes that some judges have considered 'darky' a 'term of endearment.' In South Africa, it can be considered offensive (depending on the context), but is commonly used among black people to refer to other black people in a non-derogatory way.
An Asian person.
A derogatory term for Afrikaners
A Caucasian of low class or limited income.
[1] A person of east African descent, from Cush (modern day Ethiopia or Sudan). [2] Any black African.

An Italian, Spaniard or Portuguese person, possibly derived from the Spanish name, 'Diego,' a corruption of the title Hidalgo (member of the Gentry, from Spanish > hijo de algo 'son of someone [important]' or the Sardinian language first person pronoun, dego)t.
Derived from 'turnpike'. [1] An Irish person. [2] A gypsy. [3] An itinerant or vagrant lower-class or poor person.
A person of east-central European descent. Originally referred to those of Bohemian (now Czech Republic) descent. It was commonly used toward Ukrainian immigrants during the early 20th century.
A Lithuanian, particularly a Lithuanian American.
Intentional misspelling of 'cunt'
A black person. From the West African name Kwazi, often given to a child born on a Sunday.
A disreputable and/or working class person
In Northern Ireland, a spide is a young working class male. A female is known as a millie.
A black person. Jiggaboo or jigabo is from a Bantu verb tshikabo, meaning meek or servile.
Derived from 'turnpike'. [1] An Irish person. [2] A gypsy. [3] An itinerant or vagrant lower-class or poor person.

Used to refer to Iraqis, Arabs, Afghans, or Middle Eastern and South Asian people in general. Derived from the honorific Al-Hajji, the title given to a Muslim who has completed the Hajj (pilgrimage to Mecca).
[1] Someone who acts like a homosexual [2] Something stupid.

A British (usually English) immigrant. Some claim it derives from 'Prisoner of Mother England' or 'Prisoner of Her Majesty', but it probably derives from pomegranate, rhyming slang for 'immigrant'. It is often used irreverently and is usually considered offensive. Many such migrants to Australia, such as Prime Minister Julia Gillard, call themselves 'ten pound poms', because they paid ten pounds for their passage to Australia between 1945 and 1972 under an assisted migration scheme. Often combined with an adjective, particularly whingeing pom, a reference to migrants who complained about their adopted country. Often used in a sporting (especially cricket and rugby) context, with liberal use of 'pom' and 'Aussie' being used by the media; the term is often seen as unoffensive in this context, and instead as light-hearted banter by those who use it, but still possibly as offensive by those whom it is directed at.
A Pole or a person of Polish or Slavic origin, from the Polish endonym, Polak (see Name of Poland).
In Northern Ireland, a spide is a young working class male. A female is known as a millie.
Used in the north of England, the term originates from the inability of southern Englishmen being unable to consume amounts of alcohol over 2 units at any one period.

[1] A person from Jamaica, sometimes derogatory, referring to gang membership or low economic status. [2] In the UK, can be used broadly to denote a black person with gang association and/or engaging in criminal behavior.
People of Mexican descent or, more specifically, mestizos of Central American descent. The term originates from the use of frijoles pintos and other beans in Mexican food.
A disabled person.
A white person who is acting like a black person

A person of Hispanic descent. First recorded use in 1915. Theories include from 'no spik English' (and spiggoty from the Chicano no speak-o t'e English), but common belief is that it is an abbreviation of 'Hispanic'.
The diminuitive of 'spic'

A person of Hispanic descent. First recorded use in 1915. Theories include from 'no spik English' (and spiggoty from the Chicano no speak-o t'e English), but common belief is that it is an abbreviation of 'Hispanic'.
An Asian woman, particularly of Chinese descent.
Term used by white supremacists to denote a person of mixed race.
A person from South Asia or the Middle East, particularly a person from Pakistan.
A black person.
A person of German descent.
A homosexual.
A black person. Used in the novel 'To Kill a Mockingbird'.

A black person. The term may cause offense. though Randall Kennedy's Nigger: The Strange Career of a Troublesome Word notes that some judges have considered 'darky' a 'term of endearment.' In South Africa, it can be considered offensive (depending on the context), but is commonly used among black people to refer to other black people in a non-derogatory way.
A person of perceived Chinese or East Asian descent. An offensive term that has raised considerable controversy, for example when used by comedian Rosie O'Donnell.
A person of Indian or Middle Eastern descent, based on the perceived surfeit of immigrants driving cabs in the United States.
A homosexual who engages in anal sex
[1] A person of African descent. [2] WWII slur for a Japanese person.
[1] A male Native American. [2] In Australia or New Zealand, white trash or a redneck.
Derogatory term for the Roma people
A homosexual who engages in anal sex
Canberra word for white trash or redneck, sometimes shortened to boon
Canberra word for white trash or redneck, sometimes shortened to boon
In the UK, Australia or New Zealand, an unsophisticated, antisocial, drunken and/or lower class person
A white person, from Pig Latin for 'foe.'
Person of Middle Eastern descent.
A black person. Used in the novel 'To Kill a Mockingbird'.
In Australia, Aboriginal pejorative term for white people.

A Scottish person. Scots language nickname for the personal name John, cognate to the English, Jack. Occasionally used by the English as an insult. but also in respectful reference to elite Scottish, particularly Highland troops, e.g. the 9th (Scottish) Division. Same vein as the English insult for the French, as Frogs.
Originates from pre-Civil War US. Refers to the slaves who picked cotton all day at the plantations.

A Scottish person. Scots language nickname for the personal name John, cognate to the English, Jack. Occasionally used by the English as an insult. but also in respectful reference to elite Scottish, particularly Highland troops, e.g. the 9th (Scottish) Division. Same vein as the English insult for the French, as Frogs.
A Native American.
A person of Italian descent. It can also refer to any person of Mediterranean / Southern European descent or Hispanic descent.
A person of German descent.
A person of Italian descent, derived from the Italian dialectism, 'guappo,' close to 'dude, swaggerer' and other informal appellations, a greeting among male Neapolitans.
A person who's overt about his/her Hispanic descent, particularly a Dominican
A homosexual person
A person accused of being an homosexual
A 19th century term for a black person (intended to insult both black people and Irish).

A French person, from the defeat of the French against the German in 1940, and the huge variety of cheeses originating from France. Gained popularity after the term was used on an episode of The Simpsons and was subsequently adopted by right-wing pundits. Rarely used today.
[1] A male Native American. [2] In Australia or New Zealand, white trash or a redneck.
A black servant.
A rural person, particularly Americans of Appalachia or Ozark heritage.

Used by opponents of Islamisation and Muslim immigration to denote those who in their eyes facilitate it, with connotation of 'traitor'. Used in several languages in that sense, but originally an Islamic term referring to Jewish and Christian minorities.
A Jewish person, originated in Merchant of Venice.
A rural person.
A person of Cajun ethnicity.

A black person, especially a black child. More commonly used in states where alligators are found, particularly Florida. First used in the early 20th century, although some hypothesize the term originated in the late 19th century.
Found offensive, although it is a translation of the Chinese. It was used in the gold rush and railway-construction eras in western North America, when discrimination against Chinese was common.

[1] Australian aboriginal. Boong, pronounced with (like the vowel in bull), is related to the Australian English slang word bung, meaning dead; infected; or dysfunctional. From bung, to go bung 'Originally to die, then to break down, go bankrupt, cease to function [Ab. bong dead]'. Highly offensive. [2] In New Zealand, a Pacific Islander.

A person of Italian birth or descent. Most likely derived from 'Guinea Negro,' implying that Italians are dark or swarthy-skinned like the natives of Guinea. The diminutive 'Ginzo' probably dates back to World War II and is derived from Australian slang picked up by US servicemen in the Pacific Theater.

A white person. Derived from an African-American pronunciation of 'hunky', the disparaging term for a Hungarian laborer. The first record of its use as an insulting term for a white person dates from the 1950s.
A person of mixed Caucasian and Mexican parentage.

A derogatory term used by Italians to disdainfully describe those of Anglo-Saxon descent (from Italian, literally 'cake eater'). One suggestion is that this term originated from the perception of Italian immigrants that Canadian bread is sweet as cake in comparison to the rustic bread eaten by Italians.
Abbreviation of the term 'retard'
A black person, used by Italians in US. It is a corruption of melanzane, the Italian word for eggplant.
A homosexual who engages in anal sex
An African-American perceived as being lazy and who refuses to work.
In the UK, a promiscuous woman
A child of illegal immigrants, particularly in the United States, from the notion of dropping an anchor for other family members to acquire citizenship
A Hindu person with preceived black mannerisms.
Southern laborer-class whites.
A Muslim.
Derogatory portmanteau of Muslim and Islamic
A Jew, alluding to one who escaped cremation during Holocaust.
A person of common or low class Irish ancestry.
A black person.
A homosexual.
African-Americans slur for Caucasians in the Southeast United States , particularly Caucasians in a position of authority, possibly from Efik word 'mbakara' meaning 'master'
A black person, from the character on The Little Rascals.
Used to describe urban blacks.
A person of Asian descent with perceived Caucasian mannerisms. Concatenation of Chinese and honky.
A rural person.
A disabled person, from 'retarded'.
A person of Italian descent, derived from the Italian dialectism, 'guappo,' close to 'dude, swaggerer' and other informal appellations, a greeting among male Neapolitans.
[1] A black female with light skin. [2] A black female of mixed heritage.
[1] A black female with light skin. [2] A black female of mixed heritage.
A person from Newfoundland, often used to denote lack of intelligence.
Historical Native American term for Caucasian.

A white person. Derived from an African-American pronunciation of 'hunky', the disparaging term for a Hungarian laborer. The first record of its use as an insulting term for a white person dates from the 1950s.
Caucasian person who 'acts black'
[1] A black female with light skin. [2] A black female of mixed heritage.
In Ireland, a disreputable, working class or delinquent person
A black person perceived as behaving in a subservient manner to white authority figures.
A person of Hispanic descent, from the singer of the same name.
A rural person.
[1] A person of east African descent, from Cush (modern day Ethiopia or Sudan). [2] Any black African.
A disreputable and/or working class person

[1] An Irish person or a person of Irish descent. Mick is considered more offensive in the UK and US. From the prefix 'Mc'/'Mac' meaning 'son of' that is commonly found in Irish surnames. [2] In Australia, used to denote a Roman Catholic [19th century on, from Micheal].
A rural person.
Abbreviation of the term 'retard'
A disenfranchised Irish peson, from 'shanty'.
Southern laborer-class whites.
A Native American child.
A Hindu person with preceived black mannerisms.
A homosexual who engages in anal sex
Person of Middle Eastern descent.
Historical Native American term for Caucasian.
In Ireland, a disreputable, working class or delinquent person
[1] Pejorative word for female. [2] Pejorative word for male, meaning meek or cowardly.

A white person. Derived from an African-American pronunciation of 'hunky', the disparaging term for a Hungarian laborer. The first record of its use as an insulting term for a white person dates from the 1950s.
A Canadian. Variation on the ubiquitous 'eh' and the word 'asshole'.
In Ireland, a disreputable, working class or delinquent person
A British person. Comes from the historical British naval practice of giving sailors limes to stave off scurvy.
An American, denoting racist or fascist stereotypes
A homosexual.
In Scotland, an unsophisticated or lower class female
In the UK, an unsophisticated or working class person with a predilection for ostentatious sportswear and jewellery
An idiot or offensive person, generally male, who is being compared to female genitalia
A person of mixed Mexican and African ancestry
An Argentinian.
A human female
A rural person.
An idiot or offensive person, generally male, who is being compared to female genitalia
A disreputable and/or working class person
An Australian from Queensland
An Amish person.
[1] A shiftless or unemployed person. [2] A pimp.
A human female
